intro: Tithymalus latifolius, commonly known as broadleaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
